91constexpr angle::SubjectIndex kGPUSwitchedSubjectIndex = 0;
92
93typedef std::map<EGLNativeWindowType, Surface *> WindowSurfaceMap;
94// Get a map of all EGL window surfaces to validate that no window has more than one EGL surface
95// associated with it.
96static WindowSurfaceMap *GetWindowSurfaces()
97{
98 static angle::base::NoDestructor<WindowSurfaceMap> windowSurfaces;
99 return windowSurfaces.get();
100}
101
102typedef std::map<EGLNativeDisplayType, Display *> ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap;
103static ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap()
104{
105 static angle::base::NoDestructor<ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap> displays;
106 return displays.get();
107}
108
109typedef std::map<Device *, Display *> DevicePlatformDisplayMap;
110static DevicePlatformDisplayMap *GetDevicePlatformDisplayMap()
111{
112 static angle::base::NoDestructor<DevicePlatformDisplayMap> displays;
113 return displays.get();
114}
115
116rx::DisplayImpl *CreateDisplayFromDevice(Device *eglDevice, const DisplayState &state)
117{
118 rx::DisplayImpl *impl = nullptr;
119
120 switch (eglDevice->getType())
121 {
122#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
123 case EGL_D3D11_DEVICE_ANGLE:
124 impl = new rx::DisplayD3D(state);
125 break;
126#endif
127#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D9)
128 case EGL_D3D9_DEVICE_ANGLE:
129 // Currently the only way to get EGLDeviceEXT representing a D3D9 device
130 // is to retrieve one from an already-existing EGLDisplay.
131 // When eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT is called with a D3D9 EGLDeviceEXT,
132 // the already-existing display should be returned.
133 // Therefore this codepath to create a new display from the device
134 // should never be hit.
135 UNREACHABLE();
136 break;
137#endif
138 default:
139 UNREACHABLE();
140 break;
141 }
142
143 ASSERT(impl != nullptr);
144 return impl;
145}
146
147// On platforms with support for multiple back-ends, allow an environment variable to control
148// the default. This is useful to run angle with benchmarks without having to modify the
149// benchmark source. Possible values for this environment variable (ANGLE_DEFAULT_PLATFORM)
150// are: vulkan, gl, d3d11, null.
151EGLAttrib GetDisplayTypeFromEnvironment()
152{
153 std::string angleDefaultEnv = angle::GetEnvironmentVar("ANGLE_DEFAULT_PLATFORM");
154 angle::ToLower(&angleDefaultEnv);
155
156#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
157 if ((angleDefaultEnv == "vulkan") || (angleDefaultEnv == "vulkan-null") ||
158 (angleDefaultEnv == "swiftshader"))
159 {
160 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_VULKAN_ANGLE;
161 }
162#endif
163
164#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
165 if (angleDefaultEnv == "gl")
166 {
167 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_OPENGLES_ANGLE;
168 }
169#endif
170
171#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
172 if (angleDefaultEnv == "d3d11")
173 {
174 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D11_ANGLE;
175 }
176#endif
177
178#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_NULL)
179 if (angleDefaultEnv == "null")
180 {
181 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_NULL_ANGLE;
182 }
183#endif
184#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL)
185 if (angleDefaultEnv == "metal")
186 {
187 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_METAL_ANGLE;
188 }
189
190#endif
191#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
192 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D11_ANGLE;
193#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D9)
194 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D9_ANGLE;
195#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN) && defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
196 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_VULKAN_ANGLE;
197#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
198# if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(ANGLE_USE_GBM)
199 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_OPENGLES_ANGLE;
200# else
201 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_OPENGL_ANGLE;
202# endif
203#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL)
204 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_METAL_ANGLE;
205#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
206 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_VULKAN_ANGLE;
207#elif defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_NULL)
208 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_NULL_ANGLE;
209#else
210# error No default ANGLE platform type
211#endif
212}
213
214EGLAttrib GetDeviceTypeFromEnvironment()
215{
216 std::string angleDefaultEnv = angle::GetEnvironmentVar("ANGLE_DEFAULT_PLATFORM");
217 angle::ToLower(&angleDefaultEnv);
218
219#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
220 if (angleDefaultEnv == "vulkan-null")
221 {
222 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_NULL_ANGLE;
223 }
224 else if (angleDefaultEnv == "swiftshader")
225 {
226 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_SWIFTSHADER_ANGLE;
227 }
228#endif
229 return EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_HARDWARE_ANGLE;
230}
231
232EGLAttrib GetPlatformTypeFromEnvironment()
233{
234#if defined(ANGLE_USE_OZONE)
235 return 0;
236#elif defined(ANGLE_USE_X11)
237 return EGL_PLATFORM_X11_EXT;
238#elif defined(ANGLE_USE_VULKAN_DISPLAY) && defined(ANGLE_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_SIMPLE)
239 return EGL_PLATFORM_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_SIMPLE_ANGLE;
240#elif defined(ANGLE_USE_VULKAN_DISPLAY) && defined(ANGLE_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_HEADLESS)
241 return EGL_PLATFORM_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_HEADLESS_ANGLE;
242#else
243 return 0;
244#endif // defined(ANGLE_USE_OZONE)
245}
246
247rx::DisplayImpl *CreateDisplayFromAttribs(EGLAttrib displayType,
248 EGLAttrib deviceType,
249 EGLAttrib platformType,
250 const DisplayState &state)
251{
252 ASSERT(displayType != EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_DEFAULT_ANGLE);
253 rx::DisplayImpl *impl = nullptr;
254
255 switch (displayType)
256 {
257 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_DEFAULT_ANGLE:
258 UNREACHABLE();
259 break;
260
261 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D9_ANGLE:
262 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D11_ANGLE:
263#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D9) || defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
264 impl = new rx::DisplayD3D(state);
265#else
266 // A D3D display was requested on a platform that doesn't support it
267 UNREACHABLE();
268#endif
269 break;
270
271 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_OPENGL_ANGLE:
272#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
273# if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
274 impl = new rx::DisplayWGL(state);
275 break;
276
277# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_IOS)
278 impl = rx::CreateDisplayCGLOrEAGL(state);
279 break;
280
281# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_LINUX)
282# if defined(ANGLE_USE_GBM)
283 if (platformType == 0)
284 {
285 // If platformType is unknown, use DisplayGbm now. In the future, it should use
286 // DisplayEGL letting native EGL decide what display to use.
287 impl = new rx::DisplayGbm(state);
288 break;
289 }
290# endif
291 if (deviceType == EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_EGL_ANGLE)
292 {
293 impl = new rx::DisplayEGL(state);
294 break;
295 }
296 else
297 {
298# if defined(ANGLE_USE_X11)
299 if (platformType == EGL_PLATFORM_X11_EXT)
300 {
301 impl = new rx::DisplayGLX(state);
302 break;
303 }
304# endif
305 }
306# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
307 // No GL support on this platform, fail display creation.
308 impl = nullptr;
309# else
310# error Unsupported OpenGL platform.
311# endif
312#else
313 // No display available
314 UNREACHABLE();
315#endif // defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
316 break;
317
318 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_OPENGLES_ANGLE:
319#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
320# if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
321 impl = new rx::DisplayWGL(state);
322# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_LINUX)
323# if defined(ANGLE_USE_GBM)
324 if (platformType == 0)
325 {
326 // If platformType is unknown, use DisplayGbm now. In the future, it should use
327 // DisplayEGL letting native EGL decide what display to use.
328 impl = new rx::DisplayGbm(state);
329 break;
330 }
331# endif
332 if (deviceType == EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_EGL_ANGLE)
333 {
334 impl = new rx::DisplayEGL(state);
335 break;
336 }
337 else
338 {
339# if defined(ANGLE_USE_X11)
340 if (platformType == EGL_PLATFORM_X11_EXT)
341 {
342 impl = new rx::DisplayGLX(state);
343 break;
344 }
345# endif
346 }
347# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
348 impl = new rx::DisplayAndroid(state);
349# else
350 // No GLES support on this platform, fail display creation.
351 impl = nullptr;
352# endif
353#endif // defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
354 break;
355
356 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_VULKAN_ANGLE:
357#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
358# if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_WINDOWS)
359 if (rx::IsVulkanWin32DisplayAvailable())
360 {
361 impl = rx::CreateVulkanWin32Display(state);
362 }
363# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_LINUX)
364# if defined(ANGLE_USE_X11)
365 if (platformType == EGL_PLATFORM_X11_EXT && rx::IsVulkanXcbDisplayAvailable())
366 {
367 impl = rx::CreateVulkanXcbDisplay(state);
368 break;
369 }
370# elif defined(ANGLE_USE_VULKAN_DISPLAY)
371 if (platformType == EGL_PLATFORM_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_SIMPLE_ANGLE &&
372 rx::IsVulkanSimpleDisplayAvailable())
373 {
374 impl = rx::CreateVulkanSimpleDisplay(state);
375 }
376 else if (platformType == EGL_PLATFORM_VULKAN_DISPLAY_MODE_HEADLESS_ANGLE)
377 {
378 // TODO: anglebug.com/5260
379 // Add support for headless rendering
380 UNIMPLEMENTED();
381 }
382 else
383 {
384 // Not supported creation type on vulkan display, fail display creation.
385 impl = nullptr;
386 }
387 break;
388# endif
389# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
390 if (rx::IsVulkanAndroidDisplayAvailable())
391 {
392 impl = rx::CreateVulkanAndroidDisplay(state);
393 }
394# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_FUCHSIA)
395 if (rx::IsVulkanFuchsiaDisplayAvailable())
396 {
397 impl = rx::CreateVulkanFuchsiaDisplay(state);
398 }
399# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_GGP)
400 if (rx::IsVulkanGGPDisplayAvailable())
401 {
402 impl = rx::CreateVulkanGGPDisplay(state);
403 }
404# elif defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_APPLE)
405 if (rx::IsVulkanMacDisplayAvailable())
406 {
407 impl = rx::CreateVulkanMacDisplay(state);
408 }
409# else
410# error Unsupported Vulkan platform.
411# endif
412#else
413 // No display available
414 UNREACHABLE();
415#endif // defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
416 break;
417 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_METAL_ANGLE:
418#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL)
419 if (rx::IsMetalDisplayAvailable())
420 {
421 impl = rx::CreateMetalDisplay(state);
422 break;
423 }
424#endif
425 // No display available
426 UNREACHABLE();
427 break;
428 case EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_NULL_ANGLE:
429#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_NULL)
430 impl = new rx::DisplayNULL(state);
431#else
432 // No display available
433 UNREACHABLE();
434#endif // defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_NULL)
435 break;
436
437 default:
438 UNREACHABLE();
439 break;
440 }
441
442 return impl;
443}
444
445void Display_logError(angle::PlatformMethods *platform, const char *errorMessage)
446{
447 gl::Trace(gl::LOG_ERR, errorMessage);
448}
449
450void Display_logWarning(angle::PlatformMethods *platform, const char *warningMessage)
451{
452 gl::Trace(gl::LOG_WARN, warningMessage);
453}
454
455void Display_logInfo(angle::PlatformMethods *platform, const char *infoMessage)
456{
457 // Uncomment to get info spam
458#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_DEBUG_TRACE)
459 gl::Trace(gl::LOG_INFO, infoMessage);
460#endif
461}
462
463const std::vector<std::string> EGLStringArrayToStringVector(const char **ary)
464{
465 std::vector<std::string> vec;
466 if (ary != nullptr)
467 {
468 for (; *ary != nullptr; ary++)
469 {
470 vec.push_back(std::string(*ary));
471 }
472 }
473 return vec;
474}
475
476void ANGLESetDefaultDisplayPlatform(angle::EGLDisplayType display)
477{
478 angle::PlatformMethods *platformMethods = ANGLEPlatformCurrent();
479
480 ANGLEResetDisplayPlatform(display);
481 platformMethods->logError = Display_logError;
482 platformMethods->logWarning = Display_logWarning;
483 platformMethods->logInfo = Display_logInfo;
484}

486static constexpr uint32_t kScratchBufferLifetime = 64u;

490// ShareGroup
491ShareGroup::ShareGroup(rx::EGLImplFactory *factory)
492 : mRefCount(1),
493 mImplementation(factory->createShareGroup()),
494 mFrameCaptureShared(new angle::FrameCaptureShared)
495{}
496
497ShareGroup::~ShareGroup()
498{
499 SafeDelete(mImplementation);
500}
501
502void ShareGroup::addRef()
503{
504 // This is protected by global lock, so no atomic is required
505 mRefCount++;
506}
507
508void ShareGroup::release(const Display *display)
509{
510 if (--mRefCount == 0)
511 {
512 if (mImplementation)
513 {
514 mImplementation->onDestroy(display);
515 }
516 delete this;
517 }
518}

520// DisplayState
521DisplayState::DisplayState(EGLNativeDisplayType nativeDisplayId)
522 : label(nullptr), featuresAllDisabled(false), displayId(nativeDisplayId)
523{}
524
525DisplayState::~DisplayState() {}
526
527// Note that ANGLE support on Ozone platform is limited. Our prefered support Matrix for
528// EGL_ANGLE_platform_angle on Linux and Ozone/Linux/Fuchsia platforms should be the following:
529//
530// |--------------------------------------------------------|
531// | ANGLE type | DEVICE type | PLATFORM type | Display |
532// |--------------------------------------------------------|
533// | OPENGL | EGL | ANY | EGL |
534// | OPENGL | HARDWARE | X11_EXT | GLX |
535// | OPENGLES | HARDWARE | X11_EXT | GLX |
536// | OPENGLES | EGL | ANY | EGL |
537// | VULKAN | HARDWARE | X11_EXT | VkXcb |
538// | VULKAN | SWIFTSHADER | X11_EXT | VkXcb |
539// | OPENGLES | HARDWARE | SURFACELESS_MESA | EGL* |
540// | OPENGLES | HARDWARE | DEVICE_EXT | EGL |
541// | VULKAN | HARDWARE | SURFACELESS_MESA | VkBase** |
542// | VULKAN | SWIFTSHADER | SURFACELESS_MESA | VkBase** |
543// |--------------------------------------------------------|
544//
545// * No surfaceless support yet.
546// ** Not implemented yet.
547//
548// |-----------------------------------------------|
549// | OS | BUILD type | Default PLATFORM type |
550// |-----------------------------------------------|
551// | Linux | X11 | X11_EXT |
552// | Linux | Ozone | SURFACELESS_MESA |
553// | Fuchsia | Ozone | FUCHSIA*** |
554// |-----------------------------------------------|
555//
556// *** Chosen implicitly. No EGLAttrib available.
557//
558// For more details, please refer to
559// https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XjHiDZQISq1AMrg_l1TX1_kIKvDpU76hidn9i4cAjl8/edit?disco=AAAAJl9V_YY
560//
561// static
562Display *Display::GetDisplayFromNativeDisplay(EGLNativeDisplayType nativeDisplay,
563 const AttributeMap &attribMap)
564{
565 Display *display = nullptr;
566
567 ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *displays = GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap();
568 const auto &iter = displays->find(nativeDisplay);
569 if (iter != displays->end())
570 {
571 display = iter->second;
572 }
573
574 if (display == nullptr)
575 {
576 // Validate the native display
577 if (!Display::isValidNativeDisplay(nativeDisplay))
578 {
579 return nullptr;
580 }
581
582 display = new Display(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ANGLE, nativeDisplay, nullptr);
583 displays->insert(std::make_pair(nativeDisplay, display));
584 }
585
586 // Apply new attributes if the display is not initialized yet.
587 if (!display->isInitialized())
588 {
589 display->setAttributes(attribMap);
590
591 display->updateAttribsFromEnvironment(attribMap);
592
593 EGLAttrib displayType = display->mAttributeMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_ANGLE);
594 EGLAttrib deviceType = display->mAttributeMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_ANGLE);
595 EGLAttrib platformType =
596 display->mAttributeMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_NATIVE_PLATFORM_TYPE_ANGLE);
597 rx::DisplayImpl *impl =
598 CreateDisplayFromAttribs(displayType, deviceType, platformType, display->getState());
599 if (impl == nullptr)
600 {
601 // No valid display implementation for these attributes
602 return nullptr;
603 }
604
605#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
606 angle::gUseAndroidOpenGLTlsSlot = displayType == EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_VULKAN_ANGLE;
607#endif // defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_ANDROID)
608
609 display->setupDisplayPlatform(impl);
610 }
611
612 return display;
613}
614
615// static
616Display *Display::GetExistingDisplayFromNativeDisplay(EGLNativeDisplayType nativeDisplay)
617{
618 ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *displays = GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap();
619 const auto &iter = displays->find(nativeDisplay);
620
621 // Check that there is a matching display
622 if (iter == displays->end())
623 {
624 return nullptr;
625 }
626
627 return iter->second;
628}
629
630// static
631Display *Display::GetDisplayFromDevice(Device *device, const AttributeMap &attribMap)
632{
633 Display *display = nullptr;
634
635 ASSERT(Device::IsValidDevice(device));
636
637 ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *anglePlatformDisplays = GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap();
638 DevicePlatformDisplayMap *devicePlatformDisplays = GetDevicePlatformDisplayMap();
639
640 // First see if this eglDevice is in use by a Display created using ANGLE platform
641 for (auto &displayMapEntry : *anglePlatformDisplays)
642 {
643 egl::Display *iterDisplay = displayMapEntry.second;
644 if (iterDisplay->getDevice() == device)
645 {
646 display = iterDisplay;
647 }
648 }
649
650 if (display == nullptr)
651 {
652 // See if the eglDevice is in use by a Display created using the DEVICE platform
653 const auto &iter = devicePlatformDisplays->find(device);
654 if (iter != devicePlatformDisplays->end())
655 {
656 display = iter->second;
657 }
658 }
659
660 if (display == nullptr)
661 {
662 // Otherwise create a new Display
663 display = new Display(EGL_PLATFORM_DEVICE_EXT, 0, device);
664 devicePlatformDisplays->insert(std::make_pair(device, display));
665 }
666
667 // Apply new attributes if the display is not initialized yet.
668 if (!display->isInitialized())
669 {
670 display->setAttributes(attribMap);
671 rx::DisplayImpl *impl = CreateDisplayFromDevice(device, display->getState());
672 display->setupDisplayPlatform(impl);
673 }
674
675 return display;
676}
677
678Display::Display(EGLenum platform, EGLNativeDisplayType displayId, Device *eglDevice)
679 : mState(displayId),
680 mImplementation(nullptr),
681 mGPUSwitchedBinding(this, kGPUSwitchedSubjectIndex),
682 mAttributeMap(),
683 mConfigSet(),
684 mContextSet(),
685 mStreamSet(),
686 mInitialized(false),
687 mDeviceLost(false),
688 mCaps(),
689 mDisplayExtensions(),
690 mDisplayExtensionString(),
691 mVendorString(),
692 mDevice(eglDevice),
693 mSurface(nullptr),
694 mPlatform(platform),
695 mTextureManager(nullptr),
696 mSemaphoreManager(nullptr),
697 mBlobCache(gl::kDefaultMaxProgramCacheMemoryBytes),
698 mMemoryProgramCache(mBlobCache),
699 mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers(0),
700 mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers(0)
701{}
702
703Display::~Display()
704{
705 // TODO(jmadill): When is this called?
706 // terminate();
707
708 if (mPlatform == EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ANGLE)
709 {
710 ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *displays = GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap();
711 ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap::iterator iter = displays->find(mState.displayId);
712 if (iter != displays->end())
713 {
714 displays->erase(iter);
715 }
716 }
717 else if (mPlatform == EGL_PLATFORM_DEVICE_EXT)
718 {
719 DevicePlatformDisplayMap *displays = GetDevicePlatformDisplayMap();
720 DevicePlatformDisplayMap::iterator iter = displays->find(mDevice);
721 if (iter != displays->end())
722 {
723 displays->erase(iter);
724 }
725 }
726 else
727 {
728 UNREACHABLE();
729 }
730
731 SafeDelete(mDevice);
732 SafeDelete(mImplementation);
733}
734
735void Display::setLabel(EGLLabelKHR label)
736{
737 mState.label = label;
738}
739
740EGLLabelKHR Display::getLabel() const
741{
742 return mState.label;
743}
744
745void Display::onSubjectStateChange(angle::SubjectIndex index, angle::SubjectMessage message)
746{
747 ASSERT(index == kGPUSwitchedSubjectIndex);
748 ASSERT(message == angle::SubjectMessage::SubjectChanged);
749 for (ContextSet::iterator ctx = mContextSet.begin(); ctx != mContextSet.end(); ctx++)
750 {
751 (*ctx)->onGPUSwitch();
752 }
753}
754
755void Display::setupDisplayPlatform(rx::DisplayImpl *impl)
756{
757 ASSERT(!mInitialized);
758
759 ASSERT(impl != nullptr);
760 SafeDelete(mImplementation);
761 mImplementation = impl;
762
763 // TODO(jmadill): Store Platform in Display and init here.
764 const angle::PlatformMethods *platformMethods =
765 reinterpret_cast<const angle::PlatformMethods *>(
766 mAttributeMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHODS_ANGLEX, 0));
767 if (platformMethods != nullptr)
768 {
769 *ANGLEPlatformCurrent() = *platformMethods;
770 }
771 else
772 {
773 ANGLESetDefaultDisplayPlatform(this);
774 }
775
776 const char **featuresForceEnabled =
777 reinterpret_cast<const char **>(mAttributeMap.get(EGL_FEATURE_OVERRIDES_ENABLED_ANGLE, 0));
778 const char **featuresForceDisabled =
779 reinterpret_cast<const char **>(mAttributeMap.get(EGL_FEATURE_OVERRIDES_DISABLED_ANGLE, 0));
780 mState.featureOverridesEnabled = EGLStringArrayToStringVector(featuresForceEnabled);
781 mState.featureOverridesDisabled = EGLStringArrayToStringVector(featuresForceDisabled);
782 mState.featuresAllDisabled =
783 static_cast<bool>(mAttributeMap.get(EGL_FEATURE_ALL_DISABLED_ANGLE, 0));
784 mImplementation->addObserver(&mGPUSwitchedBinding);
785}
786
787void Display::updateAttribsFromEnvironment(const AttributeMap &attribMap)
788{
789 EGLAttrib displayType =
790 attribMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_ANGLE, EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_DEFAULT_ANGLE);
791 if (displayType == EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_DEFAULT_ANGLE)
792 {
793 displayType = GetDisplayTypeFromEnvironment();
794 mAttributeMap.insert(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_ANGLE, displayType);
795 }
796 EGLAttrib deviceType = attribMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_ANGLE, 0);
797 if (deviceType == 0)
798 {
799 deviceType = GetDeviceTypeFromEnvironment();
800 mAttributeMap.insert(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_ANGLE, deviceType);
801 }
802 EGLAttrib platformType = attribMap.get(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_NATIVE_PLATFORM_TYPE_ANGLE, 0);
803 if (platformType == 0)
804 {
805 platformType = GetPlatformTypeFromEnvironment();
806 mAttributeMap.insert(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_NATIVE_PLATFORM_TYPE_ANGLE, platformType);
807 }
808}
809
810Error Display::initialize()
811{
812 ASSERT(mImplementation != nullptr);
813 mImplementation->setBlobCache(&mBlobCache);
814
815 // Enable shader caching if debug layers are turned on. This allows us to test that shaders are
816 // properly saved & restored on all platforms. The cache won't allocate space until it's used
817 // and will be ignored entirely if the application / system sets it's own cache functions.
818 if (rx::ShouldUseDebugLayers(mAttributeMap))
819 {
820 mBlobCache.resize(1024 * 1024);
821 }
822
823 setGlobalDebugAnnotator();
824
825 gl::InitializeDebugMutexIfNeeded();
826
827 SCOPED_ANGLE_HISTOGRAM_TIMER("GPU.ANGLE.DisplayInitializeMS");
828 ANGLE_TRACE_EVENT0("gpu.angle", "egl::Display::initialize");
829
830 if (isInitialized())
831 {
832 return NoError();
833 }
834
835 Error error = mImplementation->initialize(this);
836 if (error.isError())
837 {
838 // Log extended error message here
839 ERR() << "ANGLE Display::initialize error " << error.getID() << ": " << error.getMessage();
840 return error;
841 }
842
843 mCaps = mImplementation->getCaps();
844
845 mConfigSet = mImplementation->generateConfigs();
846 if (mConfigSet.size() == 0)
847 {
848 mImplementation->terminate();
849 return EglNotInitialized();
850 }
851
852 // OpenGL ES1 is implemented in the frontend, explicitly add ES1 support to all configs
853 for (auto &config : mConfigSet)
854 {
855 // TODO(geofflang): Enable the conformant bit once we pass enough tests
856 // config.second.conformant |= EGL_OPENGL_ES_BIT;
857
858 config.second.renderableType |= EGL_OPENGL_ES_BIT;
859 }
860
861 if (!mState.featuresAllDisabled)
862 {
863 initializeFrontendFeatures();
864 }
865
866 mFeatures.clear();
867 mFrontendFeatures.populateFeatureList(&mFeatures);
868 mImplementation->populateFeatureList(&mFeatures);
869
870 initDisplayExtensions();
871 initVendorString();
872
873 // Populate the Display's EGLDeviceEXT if the Display wasn't created using one
874 if (mPlatform != EGL_PLATFORM_DEVICE_EXT)
875 {
876 if (mDisplayExtensions.deviceQuery)
877 {
878 std::unique_ptr<rx::DeviceImpl> impl(mImplementation->createDevice());
879 ASSERT(impl != nullptr);
880 error = impl->initialize();
881 if (error.isError())
882 {
883 ERR() << "Failed to initialize display because device creation failed: "
884 << error.getMessage();
885 mImplementation->terminate();
886 return error;
887 }
888 mDevice = new Device(this, impl.release());
889 }
890 else
891 {
892 mDevice = nullptr;
893 }
894 }
895 else
896 {
897 // For EGL_PLATFORM_DEVICE_EXT, mDevice should always be populated using
898 // an external device
899 ASSERT(mDevice != nullptr);
900 }
901
902 mInitialized = true;
903
904 return NoError();
905}
906
907Error Display::terminate(const Thread *thread)
908{
909 if (!mInitialized)
910 {
911 return NoError();
912 }
913
914 mMemoryProgramCache.clear();
915 mBlobCache.setBlobCacheFuncs(nullptr, nullptr);
916
917 while (!mContextSet.empty())
918 {
919 ANGLE_TRY(destroyContext(thread, *mContextSet.begin()));
920 }
921
922 ANGLE_TRY(makeCurrent(thread->getContext(), nullptr, nullptr, nullptr));
923
924 // The global texture and semaphore managers should be deleted with the last context that uses
925 // it.
926 ASSERT(mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers == 0 && mTextureManager == nullptr);
927 ASSERT(mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers == 0 && mSemaphoreManager == nullptr);
928
929 while (!mImageSet.empty())
930 {
931 destroyImage(*mImageSet.begin());
932 }
933
934 while (!mStreamSet.empty())
935 {
936 destroyStream(*mStreamSet.begin());
937 }
938
939 while (!mSyncSet.empty())
940 {
941 destroySync(*mSyncSet.begin());
942 }
943
944 while (!mState.surfaceSet.empty())
945 {
946 ANGLE_TRY(destroySurface(*mState.surfaceSet.begin()));
947 }
948
949 mConfigSet.clear();
950
951 if (mDevice != nullptr && mDevice->getOwningDisplay() != nullptr)
952 {
953 // Don't delete the device if it was created externally using eglCreateDeviceANGLE
954 // We also shouldn't set it to null in case eglInitialize() is called again later
955 SafeDelete(mDevice);
956 }
957
958 mImplementation->terminate();
959
960 mDeviceLost = false;
961
962 mInitialized = false;
963
964 gl::UninitializeDebugAnnotations();
965
966 // TODO(jmadill): Store Platform in Display and deinit here.
967 ANGLEResetDisplayPlatform(this);
968
969 return NoError();
970}
971
972Error Display::prepareForCall()
973{
974 return mImplementation->prepareForCall();
975}
976
977Error Display::releaseThread()
978{
979 return mImplementation->releaseThread();
980}
981
982std::vector<const Config *> Display::getConfigs(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs) const
983{
984 return mConfigSet.filter(attribs);
985}
986
987std::vector<const Config *> Display::chooseConfig(const egl::AttributeMap &attribs) const
988{
989 egl::AttributeMap attribsWithDefaults = AttributeMap();
990
991 // Insert default values for attributes that have either an Exact or Mask selection criteria,
992 // and a default value that matters (e.g. isn't EGL_DONT_CARE):
993 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_COLOR_BUFFER_TYPE, EGL_RGB_BUFFER);
994 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_LEVEL, 0);
995 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_RENDERABLE_TYPE, EGL_OPENGL_ES_BIT);
996 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_SURFACE_TYPE, EGL_WINDOW_BIT);
997 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_TRANSPARENT_TYPE, EGL_NONE);
998 if (getExtensions().pixelFormatFloat)
999 {
1000 attribsWithDefaults.insert(EGL_COLOR_COMPONENT_TYPE_EXT,
1001 EGL_COLOR_COMPONENT_TYPE_FIXED_EXT);
1002 }
1003
1004 // Add the caller-specified values (Note: the poorly-named insert() method will replace any
1005 // of the default values from above):
1006 for (auto attribIter = attribs.begin(); attribIter != attribs.end(); attribIter++)
1007 {
1008 attribsWithDefaults.insert(attribIter->first, attribIter->second);
1009 }
1010
1011 return mConfigSet.filter(attribsWithDefaults);
1012}
1013
1014Error Display::createWindowSurface(const Config *configuration,
1015 EGLNativeWindowType window,
1016 const AttributeMap &attribs,
1017 Surface **outSurface)
1018{
1019 if (mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1020 {
1021 ANGLE_TRY(restoreLostDevice());
1022 }
1023
1024 SurfacePointer surface(new WindowSurface(mImplementation, configuration, window, attribs),
1025 this);
1026 ANGLE_TRY(surface->initialize(this));
1027
1028 ASSERT(outSurface != nullptr);
1029 *outSurface = surface.release();
1030 mState.surfaceSet.insert(*outSurface);
1031
1032 WindowSurfaceMap *windowSurfaces = GetWindowSurfaces();
1033 ASSERT(windowSurfaces && windowSurfaces->find(window) == windowSurfaces->end());
1034 windowSurfaces->insert(std::make_pair(window, *outSurface));
1035
1036 mSurface = *outSurface;
1037
1038 return NoError();
1039}
1040
1041Error Display::createPbufferSurface(const Config *configuration,
1042 const AttributeMap &attribs,
1043 Surface **outSurface)
1044{
1045 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1046
1047 if (mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1048 {
1049 ANGLE_TRY(restoreLostDevice());
1050 }
1051
1052 SurfacePointer surface(new PbufferSurface(mImplementation, configuration, attribs), this);
1053 ANGLE_TRY(surface->initialize(this));
1054
1055 ASSERT(outSurface != nullptr);
1056 *outSurface = surface.release();
1057 mState.surfaceSet.insert(*outSurface);
1058
1059 return NoError();
1060}

1076 new PbufferSurface(mImplementation, configuration, buftype, clientBuffer, attribs), this);
1077 ANGLE_TRY(surface->initialize(this));
1078
1079 ASSERT(outSurface != nullptr);
1080 *outSurface = surface.release();
1081 mState.surfaceSet.insert(*outSurface);
1082
1083 return NoError();
1084}

1108
1109Error Display::createImage(const gl::Context *context,
1110 EGLenum target,
1111 EGLClientBuffer buffer,
1112 const AttributeMap &attribs,
1113 Image **outImage)
1114{
1115 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1116
1117 if (mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1118 {
1119 ANGLE_TRY(restoreLostDevice());
1120 }
1121
1122 egl::ImageSibling *sibling = nullptr;
1123 if (IsTextureTarget(target))
1124 {
1125 sibling = context->getTexture({egl_gl::EGLClientBufferToGLObjectHandle(buffer)});
1126 }
1127 else if (IsRenderbufferTarget(target))
1128 {
1129 sibling = context->getRenderbuffer({egl_gl::EGLClientBufferToGLObjectHandle(buffer)});
1130 }
1131 else if (IsExternalImageTarget(target))
1132 {
1133 sibling = new ExternalImageSibling(mImplementation, context, target, buffer, attribs);
1134 }
1135 else
1136 {
1137 UNREACHABLE();
1138 }
1139 ASSERT(sibling != nullptr);
1140
1141 angle::UniqueObjectPointer<Image, Display> imagePtr(
1142 new Image(mImplementation, context, target, sibling, attribs), this);
1143 ANGLE_TRY(imagePtr->initialize(this));
1144
1145 Image *image = imagePtr.release();
1146
1147 ASSERT(outImage != nullptr);
1148 *outImage = image;
1149
1150 // Add this image to the list of all images and hold a ref to it.
1151 image->addRef();
1152 mImageSet.insert(image);
1153
1154 return NoError();
1155}
1156
1157Error Display::createStream(const AttributeMap &attribs, Stream **outStream)
1158{
1159 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1160
1161 Stream *stream = new Stream(this, attribs);
1162
1163 ASSERT(stream != nullptr);
1164 mStreamSet.insert(stream);
1165
1166 ASSERT(outStream != nullptr);
1167 *outStream = stream;
1168
1169 return NoError();
1170}
1171
1172Error Display::createContext(const Config *configuration,
1173 gl::Context *shareContext,
1174 EGLenum clientType,
1175 const AttributeMap &attribs,
1176 gl::Context **outContext)
1177{
1178 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1179
1180 if (mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1181 {
1182 ANGLE_TRY(restoreLostDevice());
1183 }
1184
1185 // This display texture sharing will allow the first context to create the texture share group.
1186 bool usingDisplayTextureShareGroup =
1187 attribs.get(EGL_DISPLAY_TEXTURE_SHARE_GROUP_ANGLE, EGL_FALSE) == EGL_TRUE;
1188 gl::TextureManager *shareTextures = nullptr;
1189
1190 if (usingDisplayTextureShareGroup)
1191 {
1192 ASSERT((mTextureManager == nullptr) == (mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers == 0));
1193 if (mTextureManager == nullptr)
1194 {
1195 mTextureManager = new gl::TextureManager();
1196 }
1197
1198 mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers++;
1199 shareTextures = mTextureManager;
1200 }
1201
1202 // This display semaphore sharing will allow the first context to create the semaphore share
1203 // group.
1204 bool usingDisplaySemaphoreShareGroup =
1205 attribs.get(EGL_DISPLAY_SEMAPHORE_SHARE_GROUP_ANGLE, EGL_FALSE) == EGL_TRUE;
1206 gl::SemaphoreManager *shareSemaphores = nullptr;
1207 if (usingDisplaySemaphoreShareGroup)
1208 {
1209 ASSERT((mSemaphoreManager == nullptr) == (mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers == 0));
1210 if (mSemaphoreManager == nullptr)
1211 {
1212 mSemaphoreManager = new gl::SemaphoreManager();
1213 }
1214
1215 mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers++;
1216 shareSemaphores = mSemaphoreManager;
1217 }
1218
1219 gl::MemoryProgramCache *cachePointer = &mMemoryProgramCache;
1220
1221 // Check context creation attributes to see if we are using EGL_ANGLE_program_cache_control.
1222 // If not, keep caching enabled for EGL_ANDROID_blob_cache, which can have its callbacks set
1223 // at any time.
1224 bool usesProgramCacheControl =
1225 mAttributeMap.contains(EGL_CONTEXT_PROGRAM_BINARY_CACHE_ENABLED_ANGLE);
1226 if (usesProgramCacheControl)
1227 {
1228 bool programCacheControlEnabled =
1229 (mAttributeMap.get(EGL_CONTEXT_PROGRAM_BINARY_CACHE_ENABLED_ANGLE, GL_FALSE) ==
1230 GL_TRUE);
1231 // A program cache size of zero indicates it should be disabled.
1232 if (!programCacheControlEnabled || mMemoryProgramCache.maxSize() == 0)
1233 {
1234 cachePointer = nullptr;
1235 }
1236 }
1237
1238 gl::Context *context = new gl::Context(this, configuration, shareContext, shareTextures,
1239 shareSemaphores, cachePointer, clientType, attribs,
1240 mDisplayExtensions, GetClientExtensions());
1241 if (shareContext != nullptr)
1242 {
1243 shareContext->setShared();
1244 }
1245
1246 ASSERT(context != nullptr);
1247 mContextSet.insert(context);
1248
1249 context->addRef();
1250
1251 ASSERT(outContext != nullptr);
1252 *outContext = context;
1253 return NoError();
1254}
1255
1256Error Display::createSync(const gl::Context *currentContext,
1257 EGLenum type,
1258 const AttributeMap &attribs,
1259 Sync **outSync)
1260{
1261 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1262
1263 if (mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1264 {
1265 ANGLE_TRY(restoreLostDevice());
1266 }
1267
1268 angle::UniqueObjectPointer<egl::Sync, Display> syncPtr(new Sync(mImplementation, type, attribs),
1269 this);
1270
1271 ANGLE_TRY(syncPtr->initialize(this, currentContext));
1272
1273 Sync *sync = syncPtr.release();
1274
1275 sync->addRef();
1276 mSyncSet.insert(sync);
1277
1278 *outSync = sync;
1279 return NoError();
1280}
1281
1282Error Display::makeCurrent(gl::Context *previousContext,
1283 egl::Surface *drawSurface,
1284 egl::Surface *readSurface,
1285 gl::Context *context)
1286{
1287 if (!mInitialized)
1288 {
1289 return NoError();
1290 }
1291
1292 // If the context is changing we need to update the reference counts. If it's not, e.g. just
1293 // changing the surfaces leave the reference count alone. Otherwise the reference count might go
1294 // to zero even though we know we are not done with the context.
1295 bool updateRefCount = context != previousContext;
1296 if (previousContext != nullptr)
1297 {
1298 ANGLE_TRY(previousContext->unMakeCurrent(this));
1299 if (updateRefCount)
1300 {
1301 ANGLE_TRY(releaseContext(previousContext));
1302 }
1303 }
1304
1305 ANGLE_TRY(mImplementation->makeCurrent(this, drawSurface, readSurface, context));
1306
1307 if (context != nullptr)
1308 {
1309 ANGLE_TRY(context->makeCurrent(this, drawSurface, readSurface));
1310 if (updateRefCount)
1311 {
1312 context->addRef();
1313 }
1314 }
1315
1316 // Tick all the scratch buffers to make sure they get cleaned up eventually if they stop being
1317 // used.
1318 {
1319 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mScratchBufferMutex);
1320
1321 for (angle::ScratchBuffer &scatchBuffer : mScratchBuffers)
1322 {
1323 scatchBuffer.tick();
1324 }
1325 for (angle::ScratchBuffer &zeroFilledBuffer : mZeroFilledBuffers)
1326 {
1327 zeroFilledBuffer.tick();
1328 }
1329 }
1330
1331 return NoError();
1332}
1333
1334Error Display::makeCurrent(const Thread *thread,
1335 egl::Surface *drawSurface,
1336 egl::Surface *readSurface,
1337 gl::Context *context)
1338{
1339 if (!mInitialized)
1340 {
1341 return NoError();
1342 }
1343
1344 gl::Context *previousContext = thread->getContext();
1345 if (previousContext)
1346 {
1347 ANGLE_TRY(previousContext->unMakeCurrent(this));
1348 }
1349
1350 ANGLE_TRY(mImplementation->makeCurrent(this, drawSurface, readSurface, context));
1351
1352 if (context != nullptr)
1353 {
1354 ANGLE_TRY(context->makeCurrent(this, drawSurface, readSurface));
1355 }
1356
1357 // Tick all the scratch buffers to make sure they get cleaned up eventually if they stop being
1358 // used.
1359 {
1360 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mScratchBufferMutex);
1361
1362 for (angle::ScratchBuffer &scatchBuffer : mScratchBuffers)
1363 {
1364 scatchBuffer.tick();
1365 }
1366 for (angle::ScratchBuffer &zeroFilledBuffer : mZeroFilledBuffers)
1367 {
1368 zeroFilledBuffer.tick();
1369 }
1370 }
1371
1372 return NoError();
1373}
1374
1375Error Display::restoreLostDevice()
1376{
1377 for (ContextSet::iterator ctx = mContextSet.begin(); ctx != mContextSet.end(); ctx++)
1378 {
1379 if ((*ctx)->isResetNotificationEnabled())
1380 {
1381 // If reset notifications have been requested, application must delete all contexts
1382 // first
1383 return EglContextLost();
1384 }
1385 }
1386
1387 return mImplementation->restoreLostDevice(this);
1388}
1389
1390Error Display::destroySurface(Surface *surface)
1391{
1392 if (surface->getType() == EGL_WINDOW_BIT)
1393 {
1394 WindowSurfaceMap *windowSurfaces = GetWindowSurfaces();
1395 ASSERT(windowSurfaces);
1396
1397 bool surfaceRemoved = false;
1398 for (WindowSurfaceMap::iterator iter = windowSurfaces->begin();
1399 iter != windowSurfaces->end(); iter++)
1400 {
1401 if (iter->second == surface)
1402 {
1403 windowSurfaces->erase(iter);
1404 surfaceRemoved = true;
1405 break;
1406 }
1407 }
1408
1409 ASSERT(surfaceRemoved);
1410 }
1411
1412 mState.surfaceSet.erase(surface);
1413 ANGLE_TRY(surface->onDestroy(this));
1414 return NoError();
1415}
1416
1417void Display::destroyImage(egl::Image *image)
1418{
1419 auto iter = mImageSet.find(image);
1420 ASSERT(iter != mImageSet.end());
1421 (*iter)->release(this);
1422 mImageSet.erase(iter);
1423}
1424
1425void Display::destroyStream(egl::Stream *stream)
1426{
1427 mStreamSet.erase(stream);
1428 SafeDelete(stream);
1429}
1430
1431// releaseContext must be called with the context being deleted as current.
1432// To do that we can only call this in two places, Display::makeCurrent at the point where this
1433// context is being made uncurrent and in Display::destroyContext where we make the context current
1434// as part of destruction.
1435Error Display::releaseContext(gl::Context *context)
1436{
1437 context->release();
1438 size_t refCount = context->getRefCount();
1439 if (refCount > 0)
1440 {
1441 return NoError();
1442 }
1443
1444 if (context->usingDisplayTextureShareGroup())
1445 {
1446 ASSERT(mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers >= 1 && mTextureManager != nullptr);
1447 if (mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers == 1)
1448 {
1449 // If this is the last context using the global share group, destroy the global
1450 // texture manager so that the textures can be destroyed while a context still
1451 // exists
1452 mTextureManager->release(context);
1453 mTextureManager = nullptr;
1454 }
1455 mGlobalTextureShareGroupUsers--;
1456 }
1457
1458 if (context->usingDisplaySemaphoreShareGroup())
1459 {
1460 ASSERT(mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers >= 1 && mSemaphoreManager != nullptr);
1461 if (mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers == 1)
1462 {
1463 // If this is the last context using the global share group, destroy the global
1464 // semaphore manager so that the semaphores can be destroyed while a context still
1465 // exists
1466 mSemaphoreManager->release(context);
1467 mSemaphoreManager = nullptr;
1468 }
1469 mGlobalSemaphoreShareGroupUsers--;
1470 }
1471
1472 ANGLE_TRY(context->onDestroy(this));
1473 mContextSet.erase(context);
1474 SafeDelete(context);
1475
1476 return NoError();
1477}
1478
1479Error Display::destroyContext(const Thread *thread, gl::Context *context)
1480{
1481 size_t refCount = context->getRefCount();
1482 if (refCount > 1)
1483 {
1484 context->release();
1485 return NoError();
1486 }
1487
1488 // This is the last reference for this context, so we can destroy it now.
1489 gl::Context *currentContext = thread->getContext();
1490 Surface *currentDrawSurface = thread->getCurrentDrawSurface();
1491 Surface *currentReadSurface = thread->getCurrentReadSurface();
1492 bool changeContextForDeletion = context != currentContext;
1493
1494 // Make the context being deleted current during its deletion. This allows it to delete
1495 // any resources it's holding.
1496 if (changeContextForDeletion)
1497 {
1498 ANGLE_TRY(makeCurrent(currentContext, nullptr, nullptr, context));
1499 }
1500
1501 ANGLE_TRY(releaseContext(context));
1502
1503 // Set the previous context back to current
1504 if (changeContextForDeletion)
1505 {
1506 ANGLE_TRY(makeCurrent(context, currentDrawSurface, currentReadSurface, currentContext));
1507 }
1508
1509 return NoError();
1510}
1511
1512void Display::destroySync(egl::Sync *sync)
1513{
1514 auto iter = mSyncSet.find(sync);
1515 ASSERT(iter != mSyncSet.end());
1516 (*iter)->release(this);
1517 mSyncSet.erase(iter);
1518}
1519
1520bool Display::isDeviceLost() const
1521{
1522 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1523 return mDeviceLost;
1524}
1525
1526bool Display::testDeviceLost()
1527{
1528 ASSERT(isInitialized());
1529
1530 if (!mDeviceLost && mImplementation->testDeviceLost())
1531 {
1532 notifyDeviceLost();
1533 }
1534
1535 return mDeviceLost;
1536}
1537
1538void Display::notifyDeviceLost()
1539{
1540 if (mDeviceLost)
1541 {
1542 return;
1543 }
1544
1545 for (ContextSet::iterator context = mContextSet.begin(); context != mContextSet.end();
1546 context++)
1547 {
1548 (*context)->markContextLost(gl::GraphicsResetStatus::UnknownContextReset);
1549 }
1550
1551 mDeviceLost = true;
1552}
1553
1554void Display::setBlobCacheFuncs(EGLSetBlobFuncANDROID set, EGLGetBlobFuncANDROID get)
1555{
1556 mBlobCache.setBlobCacheFuncs(set, get);
1557 mImplementation->setBlobCacheFuncs(set, get);
1558}
1559
1560// static
1561EGLClientBuffer Display::GetNativeClientBuffer(const AHardwareBuffer *buffer)
1562{
1563 return angle::android::AHardwareBufferToClientBuffer(buffer);
1564}
1565
1566// static
1567Error Display::CreateNativeClientBuffer(const egl::AttributeMap &attribMap,
1568 EGLClientBuffer *eglClientBuffer)
1569{
1570 int androidHardwareBufferFormat = gl::GetAndroidHardwareBufferFormatFromChannelSizes(attribMap);
1571 int width = attribMap.getAsInt(EGL_WIDTH, 0);
1572 int height = attribMap.getAsInt(EGL_HEIGHT, 0);
1573 int usage = attribMap.getAsInt(EGL_NATIVE_BUFFER_USAGE_ANDROID, 0);
1574
1575 // https://developer.android.com/ndk/reference/group/a-hardware-buffer#ahardwarebuffer_lock
1576 // for AHardwareBuffer_lock()
1577 // The passed AHardwareBuffer must have one layer, otherwise the call will fail.
1578 constexpr int kLayerCount = 1;
1579
1580 *eglClientBuffer = angle::android::CreateEGLClientBufferFromAHardwareBuffer(
1581 width, height, kLayerCount, androidHardwareBufferFormat, usage);
1582
1583 return (*eglClientBuffer == nullptr)
1584 ? egl::EglBadParameter() << "native client buffer allocation failed."
1585 : NoError();
1586}

1591}

1645
1646static ClientExtensions GenerateClientExtensions()
1647{
1648 ClientExtensions extensions;
1649
1650 extensions.clientExtensions = true;
1651 extensions.platformBase = true;
1652 extensions.platformANGLE = true;
1653
1654#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D9) || defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
1655 extensions.platformANGLED3D = true;
1656 extensions.platformDevice = true;
1657#endif
1658
1659#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
1660# if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_WINDOWS_UWP)
1661 extensions.platformANGLED3D11ON12 = true;
1662# else
1663 extensions.platformANGLED3D11ON12 = IsWindows10OrGreater();
1664# endif
1665#endif
1666
1667#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_OPENGL)
1668 extensions.platformANGLEOpenGL = true;
1669
1670 // Selecting context virtualization is currently only supported in the OpenGL backend.
1671 extensions.platformANGLEContextVirtualization = true;
1672#endif
1673
1674#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_NULL)
1675 extensions.platformANGLENULL = true;
1676#endif
1677
1678#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_D3D11)
1679 extensions.deviceCreation = true;
1680 extensions.deviceCreationD3D11 = true;
1681 extensions.experimentalPresentPath = true;
1682#endif
1683
1684#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_VULKAN)
1685 extensions.platformANGLEVulkan = true;
1686#endif
1687
1688#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_SWIFTSHADER)
1689 extensions.platformANGLEDeviceTypeSwiftShader = true;
1690#endif
1691
1692#if defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_METAL)
1693 extensions.platformANGLEMetal = true;
1694#endif
1695
1696#if defined(ANGLE_USE_X11)
1697 extensions.x11Visual = true;
1698#endif
1699
1700#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_LINUX)
1701 extensions.platformANGLEDeviceTypeEGLANGLE = true;
1702#endif
1703
1704#if (defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_IOS) && !defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST)) || \
1705 (defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST) && defined(ANGLE_CPU_ARM64))
1706 extensions.platformANGLEDeviceContextVolatileEagl = true;
1707#endif
1708
1709#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACOS) || defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_MACCATALYST)
1710 extensions.platformANGLEDeviceContextVolatileCgl = true;
1711#endif
1712
1713 extensions.clientGetAllProcAddresses = true;
1714 extensions.debug = true;
1715 extensions.explicitContext = true;
1716 extensions.featureControlANGLE = true;
1717
1718 return extensions;
1719}
1720
1721template <typename T>
1722static std::string GenerateExtensionsString(const T &extensions)
1723{
1724 std::vector<std::string> extensionsVector = extensions.getStrings();
1725
1726 std::ostringstream stream;
1727 std::copy(extensionsVector.begin(), extensionsVector.end(),
1728 std::ostream_iterator<std::string>(stream, " "));
1729 return stream.str();
1730}
1731
1732// static
1733const ClientExtensions &Display::GetClientExtensions()
1734{
1735 static const ClientExtensions clientExtensions = GenerateClientExtensions();
1736 return clientExtensions;
1737}
1738
1739// static
1740const std::string &Display::GetClientExtensionString()
1741{
1742 static const angle::base::NoDestructor<std::string> clientExtensionsString(
1743 GenerateExtensionsString(GetClientExtensions()));
1744 return *clientExtensionsString;
1745}
1746
1747void Display::initDisplayExtensions()
1748{
1749 mDisplayExtensions = mImplementation->getExtensions();
1750
1751 // Some extensions are always available because they are implemented in the EGL layer.
1752 mDisplayExtensions.createContext = true;
1753 mDisplayExtensions.createContextNoError = true;
1754 mDisplayExtensions.createContextWebGLCompatibility = true;
1755 mDisplayExtensions.createContextBindGeneratesResource = true;
1756 mDisplayExtensions.createContextClientArrays = true;
1757 mDisplayExtensions.pixelFormatFloat = true;
1758 mDisplayExtensions.reusableSyncKHR = true;
1759
1760 // Force EGL_KHR_get_all_proc_addresses on.
1761 mDisplayExtensions.getAllProcAddresses = true;
1762
1763 // Enable program cache control since it is not back-end dependent.
1764 mDisplayExtensions.programCacheControl = true;
1765
1766 // Request extension is implemented in the ANGLE frontend
1767 mDisplayExtensions.createContextExtensionsEnabled = true;
1768
1769 // Blob cache extension is provided by the ANGLE frontend
1770 mDisplayExtensions.blobCache = true;
1771
1772 // The EGL_ANDROID_recordable extension is provided by the ANGLE frontend, and will always
1773 // say that ANativeWindow is not recordable.
1774 mDisplayExtensions.recordable = true;
1775
1776 // All backends support specific context versions
1777 mDisplayExtensions.createContextBackwardsCompatible = true;
1778
1779 mDisplayExtensionString = GenerateExtensionsString(mDisplayExtensions);
1780}
1781
1782bool Display::isValidNativeWindow(EGLNativeWindowType window) const
1783{
1784 return mImplementation->isValidNativeWindow(window);
1785}

1809
1810bool Display::isValidDisplay(const egl::Display *display)
1811{
1812 const ANGLEPlatformDisplayMap *anglePlatformDisplayMap = GetANGLEPlatformDisplayMap();
1813 for (const auto &displayPair : *anglePlatformDisplayMap)
1814 {
1815 if (displayPair.second == display)
1816 {
1817 return true;
1818 }
1819 }
1820
1821 const DevicePlatformDisplayMap *devicePlatformDisplayMap = GetDevicePlatformDisplayMap();
1822 for (const auto &displayPair : *devicePlatformDisplayMap)
1823 {
1824 if (displayPair.second == display)
1825 {
1826 return true;
1827 }
1828 }
1829
1830 return false;
1831}
1832
1833bool Display::isValidNativeDisplay(EGLNativeDisplayType display)
1834{
1835 // TODO(jmadill): handle this properly
1836 if (display == EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY)
1837 {
1838 return true;
1839 }
1840
1841#if defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_WINDOWS) && !defined(ANGLE_ENABLE_WINDOWS_UWP)
1842 if (display == EGL_SOFTWARE_DISPLAY_ANGLE || display == EGL_D3D11_ELSE_D3D9_DISPLAY_ANGLE ||
1843 display == EGL_D3D11_ONLY_DISPLAY_ANGLE)
1844 {
1845 return true;
1846 }
1847 return (WindowFromDC(display) != nullptr);
1848#else
1849 return true;
1850#endif
1851}

1858void Display::initializeFrontendFeatures()
1859{
1860 // Enable on all Impls
1861 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFrontendFeatures), loseContextOnOutOfMemory, true);
1862 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFrontendFeatures), scalarizeVecAndMatConstructorArgs, true);
1863 ANGLE_FEATURE_CONDITION((&mFrontendFeatures), allowCompressedFormats, true);
1864
1865 mImplementation->initializeFrontendFeatures(&mFrontendFeatures);
1866
1867 rx::ApplyFeatureOverrides(&mFrontendFeatures, mState);
1868}

1899
1900EGLint Display::programCacheGetAttrib(EGLenum attrib) const
1901{
1902 switch (attrib)
1903 {
1904 case EGL_PROGRAM_CACHE_KEY_LENGTH_ANGLE:
1905 return static_cast<EGLint>(BlobCache::kKeyLength);
1906
1907 case EGL_PROGRAM_CACHE_SIZE_ANGLE:
1908 return static_cast<EGLint>(mMemoryProgramCache.entryCount());
1909
1910 default:
1911 UNREACHABLE();
1912 return 0;
1913 }
1914}
1915
1916Error Display::programCacheQuery(EGLint index,
1917 void *key,
1918 EGLint *keysize,
1919 void *binary,
1920 EGLint *binarysize)
1921{
1922 ASSERT(index >= 0 && index < static_cast<EGLint>(mMemoryProgramCache.entryCount()));
1923
1924 const BlobCache::Key *programHash = nullptr;
1925 BlobCache::Value programBinary;
1926 // TODO(jmadill): Make this thread-safe.
1927 bool result =
1928 mMemoryProgramCache.getAt(static_cast<size_t>(index), &programHash, &programBinary);
1929 if (!result)
1930 {
1931 return EglBadAccess() << "Program binary not accessible.";
1932 }
1933
1934 ASSERT(keysize && binarysize);
1935
1936 if (key)
1937 {
1938 ASSERT(*keysize == static_cast<EGLint>(BlobCache::kKeyLength));
1939 memcpy(key, programHash->data(), BlobCache::kKeyLength);
1940 }
1941
1942 if (binary)
1943 {
1944 // Note: we check the size here instead of in the validation code, since we need to
1945 // access the cache as atomically as possible. It's possible that the cache contents
1946 // could change between the validation size check and the retrieval.
1947 if (programBinary.size() > static_cast<size_t>(*binarysize))
1948 {
1949 return EglBadAccess() << "Program binary too large or changed during access.";
1950 }
1951
1952 memcpy(binary, programBinary.data(), programBinary.size());
1953 }
1954
1955 *binarysize = static_cast<EGLint>(programBinary.size());
1956 *keysize = static_cast<EGLint>(BlobCache::kKeyLength);
1957
1958 return NoError();
1959}
1960
1961Error Display::programCachePopulate(const void *key,
1962 EGLint keysize,
1963 const void *binary,
1964 EGLint binarysize)
1965{
1966 ASSERT(keysize == static_cast<EGLint>(BlobCache::kKeyLength));
1967
1968 BlobCache::Key programHash;
1969 memcpy(programHash.data(), key, BlobCache::kKeyLength);
1970
1971 if (!mMemoryProgramCache.putBinary(programHash, reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(binary),
1972 static_cast<size_t>(binarysize)))
1973 {
1974 return EglBadAccess() << "Failed to copy program binary into the cache.";
1975 }
1976
1977 return NoError();
1978}
1979
1980EGLint Display::programCacheResize(EGLint limit, EGLenum mode)
1981{
1982 switch (mode)
1983 {
1984 case EGL_PROGRAM_CACHE_RESIZE_ANGLE:
1985 {
1986 size_t initialSize = mMemoryProgramCache.size();
1987 mMemoryProgramCache.resize(static_cast<size_t>(limit));
1988 return static_cast<EGLint>(initialSize);
1989 }
1990
1991 case EGL_PROGRAM_CACHE_TRIM_ANGLE:
1992 return static_cast<EGLint>(mMemoryProgramCache.trim(static_cast<size_t>(limit)));
1993
1994 default:
1995 UNREACHABLE();
1996 return 0;
1997 }
1998}
1999
2000void Display::overrideFrontendFeatures(const std::vector<std::string> &featureNames, bool enabled)
2001{
2002 mFrontendFeatures.overrideFeatures(featureNames, enabled);
2003}
2004
2005const char *Display::queryStringi(const EGLint name, const EGLint index)
2006{
2007 const char *result = nullptr;
2008 switch (name)
2009 {
2010 case EGL_FEATURE_NAME_ANGLE:
2011 result = mFeatures[index]->name;
2012 break;
2013 case EGL_FEATURE_CATEGORY_ANGLE:
2014 result = angle::FeatureCategoryToString(mFeatures[index]->category);
2015 break;
2016 case EGL_FEATURE_DESCRIPTION_ANGLE:
2017 result = mFeatures[index]->description;
2018 break;
2019 case EGL_FEATURE_BUG_ANGLE:
2020 result = mFeatures[index]->bug;
2021 break;
2022 case EGL_FEATURE_STATUS_ANGLE:
2023 result = angle::FeatureStatusToString(mFeatures[index]->enabled);
2024 break;
2025 case EGL_FEATURE_CONDITION_ANGLE:
2026 result = mFeatures[index]->condition;
2027 break;
2028 default:
2029 UNREACHABLE();
2030 return nullptr;
2031 }
2032 return result;
2033}
2034
2035EGLAttrib Display::queryAttrib(const EGLint attribute)
2036{
2037 EGLAttrib value = 0;
2038 switch (attribute)
2039 {
2040 case EGL_DEVICE_EXT:
2041 value = reinterpret_cast<EGLAttrib>(mDevice);
2042 break;
2043
2044 case EGL_FEATURE_COUNT_ANGLE:
2045 value = mFeatures.size();
2046 break;
2047
2048 default:
2049 UNREACHABLE();
2050 }
2051 return value;
2052}
2053
2054angle::ScratchBuffer Display::requestScratchBuffer()
2055{
2056 return requestScratchBufferImpl(&mScratchBuffers);
2057}
2058
2059void Display::returnScratchBuffer(angle::ScratchBuffer scratchBuffer)
2060{
2061 returnScratchBufferImpl(std::move(scratchBuffer), &mScratchBuffers);
2062}
2063
2064angle::ScratchBuffer Display::requestZeroFilledBuffer()
2065{
2066 return requestScratchBufferImpl(&mZeroFilledBuffers);
2067}
2068
2069void Display::returnZeroFilledBuffer(angle::ScratchBuffer zeroFilledBuffer)
2070{
2071 returnScratchBufferImpl(std::move(zeroFilledBuffer), &mZeroFilledBuffers);
2072}
2073
2074angle::ScratchBuffer Display::requestScratchBufferImpl(
2075 std::vector<angle::ScratchBuffer> *bufferVector)
2076{
2077 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mScratchBufferMutex);
2078 if (!bufferVector->empty())
2079 {
2080 angle::ScratchBuffer buffer = std::move(bufferVector->back());
2081 bufferVector->pop_back();
2082 return buffer;
2083 }
2084
2085 return angle::ScratchBuffer(kScratchBufferLifetime);
2086}
2087
2088void Display::returnScratchBufferImpl(angle::ScratchBuffer scratchBuffer,
2089 std::vector<angle::ScratchBuffer> *bufferVector)
2090{
2091 std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(mScratchBufferMutex);
2092 bufferVector->push_back(std::move(scratchBuffer));
2093}

2095egl::Error Display::handleGPUSwitch()
2096{
2097 return mImplementation->handleGPUSwitch();
2098}
